domains.name: Enterprise Risk Management (ERM)
domains.description: Enterprise Risk Management (ERM) involves identifying, assessing, and managing risks across an organization to ensure that they are within the company's risk appetite. It integrates risk management into the strategic planning and decision-making processes.
domains.importance: ERM is crucial as it helps organizations proactively manage risks, improve decision-making, and enhance overall performance. It ensures that potential risks are identified and mitigated before they can impact the organization.
domains.relation_to_organization: ERM relates to an organization by providing a comprehensive framework for managing risks across all departments and levels. It aligns risk management with the organization's goals and objectives, ensuring a unified approach to handling uncertainties.

document_types.name: Enterprise Risk Management Program Requirements
document_types.purpose: To define the requirements of the Enterprise Risk Management program.

document_types.name: Risk Assessment Process Documentation
document_types.purpose: To outline the organization's risk assessment process, risk register, and risk management lifecycle.

document_types.name: Inventory of Applicable Risks and Controls
document_types.purpose: To list and track applicable risks and controls within the risk management program.

domains.name: Nth Party Management
domains.description: Nth Party Management refers to the oversight and management of risks associated with third parties, such as suppliers, vendors, and partners. It ensures that these external entities comply with the organization's risk management policies and standards.
domains.importance: Effective Nth Party Management is essential for minimizing risks that originate from external sources. It helps protect the organization from potential disruptions, financial losses, and reputational damage caused by third-party failures.
domains.relation_to_organization: Nth Party Management is related to the organization by ensuring that all external partners adhere to the same risk management standards as the organization itself. It involves continuous monitoring, assessment, and mitigation of risks posed by third parties.

document_types.name: Third Party Risk Management Program Documentation
document_types.purpose: To define the organization's third-party risk management program and assessment requirements.
document_types.compliance: Complies with GDPR and other relevant regulations

document_types.name: Third Party Inventory and Vendor Classification
document_types.purpose: To maintain a structured inventory and classification of third-party vendors.
document_types.compliance: Complies with GDPR and other relevant regulations

document_types.name: Contract Clauses in Fourth Party Agreements
document_types.purpose: To outline the organization's process for addressing contract clauses within fourth party agreements.

domains.name: Information Assurance
domains.description: Information Assurance involves measures that protect and defend information and information systems by ensuring their availability, integrity, authentication, confidentiality, and non-repudiation.
domains.importance: Information Assurance is critical for protecting sensitive data and maintaining the trust of customers, partners, and stakeholders. It helps prevent data breaches and ensures compliance with regulatory requirements.
domains.relation_to_organization: Information Assurance relates to the organization by ensuring that all data and information systems are secure and resilient against threats. It supports the overall security posture of the organization.

document_types.name: Information Security Standards
document_types.purpose: To outline the organization's information security standards.

document_types.name: Information Security Policies
document_types.purpose: To define the organization's information security policies.

document_types.name: Information Security Organizational Document
document_types.purpose: To document the organization's approved Information Security (IS) roles and responsibilities.

domains.name: Asset and Information Management
domains.description: Asset and Information Management involves the processes and policies for managing the organization's information assets, including data classification, data handling, and the tracking of physical media.
domains.importance: Proper management of information assets ensures their availability, integrity, and confidentiality. It helps prevent data loss, unauthorized access, and ensures compliance with legal and regulatory requirements.
domains.relation_to_organization: Asset and Information Management relates to the organization by providing a structured approach to managing information assets throughout their lifecycle. It supports data governance and security initiatives.

document_types.name: Information Asset Management Program
document_types.purpose: To define the organization's information asset management program.

document_types.name: Data Classification and Handling Procedures
document_types.purpose: To outline the procedures for data classification and handling.
document_types.compliance: Complies with GDPR and other relevant regulations

document_types.name: Physical Media Tracking
document_types.purpose: To document the policies, procedures, and logs used for tracking inbound and outbound physical media.
document_types.compliance: Complies with GDPR and other relevant regulations

domains.name: Human Resources Security
domains.description: Human Resources Security involves policies and procedures to ensure the security of employees, contractors, and other personnel with access to sensitive information or systems.
domains.importance: Human Resources Security is essential for safeguarding the organization against insider threats and ensuring that personnel comply with security policies. It helps maintain a secure work environment and protects sensitive information.
domains.relation_to_organization: Human Resources Security relates to the organization by managing the security of its workforce. It includes background checks, security awareness training, and procedures for managing employee separations.

document_types.name: Human Resource Security and Background Investigation
document_types.purpose: To document the current human resource security and background investigation policies and procedures.
document_types.compliance: Complies with relevant employment laws and regulations

document_types.name: Acknowledgement and Receipt of Company Policies
document_types.purpose: To document the policies and procedures for acknowledgement and receipt of company policies.

document_types.name: Security Awareness Training Program
document_types.purpose: To outline the organization's security awareness training program.

domains.name: Physical and Environmental Security
domains.description: Physical and Environmental Security involves measures to protect the organization's physical assets and facilities from unauthorized access, damage, and environmental threats.
domains.importance: Physical and Environmental Security is crucial for protecting the organization's physical assets, including hardware, facilities, and personnel. It helps prevent theft, damage, and ensures the continuity of operations.
domains.relation_to_organization: Physical and Environmental Security relates to the organization by providing a framework for securing physical assets and facilities. It includes access controls, environmental monitoring, and emergency response plans.

document_types.name: Environmental Controls
document_types.purpose: To document the organization's policies, standards, or guidelines for environmental controls.

document_types.name: Physical Access to Data or Systems
document_types.purpose: To outline the policies, standards, or guidelines for physical access to data or systems.

document_types.name: Physical Security and Risk Management Programs
document_types.purpose: To document the secure workspace physical security and risk management programs.

domains.name: IT Operations Management
domains.description: IT Operations Management involves managing the day-to-day operations of the organization's IT infrastructure, ensuring the availability, performance, and security of IT services.
domains.importance: IT Operations Management is critical for maintaining the continuity and efficiency of IT services. It ensures that IT systems are reliable, secure, and aligned with the organization's goals.
domains.relation_to_organization: IT Operations Management relates to the organization by overseeing the IT infrastructure and services that support business operations. It includes change management, incident management, and system monitoring.

document_types.name: Change Management Policies and Procedures
document_types.purpose: To document the policies and procedures related to change management.

document_types.name: Security Patch Process
document_types.purpose: To outline the security patch process, including the name of the tool used for patch management.

document_types.name: IT Operational Procedures
document_types.purpose: To document the organization's IT operational procedures.

domains.name: Access Control
domains.description: Access Control involves policies and procedures to regulate who can access the organization's information systems and data. It ensures that only authorized individuals can access sensitive information.
domains.importance: Access Control is essential for protecting sensitive data and preventing unauthorized access. It helps ensure data integrity and confidentiality, reducing the risk of data breaches.
domains.relation_to_organization: Access Control relates to the organization by providing a framework for managing user access to information systems. It includes policies for user authentication, authorization, and access monitoring.

document_types.name: Access Control Policies and Procedures
document_types.purpose: To document the policies and procedures for access control.

document_types.name: Corporate Password Policies and Procedures
document_types.purpose: To define the corporate password policies and procedures.

document_types.name: Inactive Accounts Management
document_types.purpose: To outline the process for reviewing, revoking, or disabling access to inactive accounts.

domains.name: Application Management
domains.description: Application Management involves overseeing the lifecycle of the organization's applications, ensuring they are developed, maintained, and operated securely and efficiently.
domains.importance: Application Management is critical for ensuring that the organization's applications are secure, reliable, and meet business requirements. It helps prevent security vulnerabilities and ensures compliance with regulatory standards.
domains.relation_to_organization: Application Management relates to the organization by managing the development, deployment, and maintenance of applications. It includes application security, quality assurance, and change management.

document_types.name: Architecture and Application Security Risk Governance
document_types.purpose: To document the organization's architecture governance program and application security risk governance program.

document_types.name: SDLC Controls
document_types.purpose: To define the policies, standards, and procedures related to Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) controls.

document_types.name: Application Security Testing Requirements
document_types.purpose: To outline the organization's application security testing requirements and processes.

domains.name: Cybersecurity Incident Management
domains.description: Cybersecurity Incident Management involves preparing for, detecting, analyzing, containing, eradicating, and recovering from cybersecurity incidents. It ensures that the organization can respond effectively to security breaches.
domains.importance: Cybersecurity Incident Management is essential for minimizing the impact of security incidents. It helps protect sensitive data, maintain business continuity, and comply with regulatory requirements.
domains.relation_to_organization: Cybersecurity Incident Management relates to the organization by providing a structured approach to handling security incidents. It includes incident response plans, containment strategies, and recovery procedures.

document_types.name: Incident Management Policies, Plans, and Procedures
document_types.purpose: To document the organization's incident management policies, plans, and procedures.

document_types.name: Incident Handling Resources and Tools
document_types.purpose: To detail the resources and tools available for information security/information technology incident handling.

document_types.name: Incident Identification and Common Attack Vectors
document_types.purpose: To outline the process for identifying incidents and the common attack vectors related to those incidents.

domains.name: Operational Resilience
domains.description: Operational Resilience involves the ability of an organization to anticipate, prepare for, respond to, and adapt to incremental change and sudden disruptions to maintain business operations.
domains.importance: Operational Resilience is crucial for ensuring that an organization can continue to operate during and after disruptions. It helps minimize the impact of incidents and ensures the continuity of critical business functions.
domains.relation_to_organization: Operational Resilience relates to the organization by providing a framework for managing risks to business operations. It includes business continuity planning, disaster recovery, and crisis management.

document_types.name: Business Resilience Policy
document_types.purpose: To document the organization's business resilience policy and roles and responsibilities.

document_types.name: Enterprise and Location Level Risk Assessments
document_types.purpose: To document the results of the latest enterprise and location level risk assessments.

document_types.name: Crisis Management and Business Continuity Plans
document_types.purpose: To document the organization's crisis management and business continuity plans.

domains.name: Compliance Management
domains.description: Compliance Management involves ensuring that the organization adheres to relevant laws, regulations, policies, and standards. It includes managing compliance risks and ensuring that business practices align with legal and regulatory requirements.
domains.importance: Compliance Management is essential for avoiding legal penalties, maintaining the organization's reputation, and ensuring that business practices are ethical and lawful.
domains.relation_to_organization: Compliance Management relates to the organization by providing a framework for managing compliance risks. It includes monitoring compliance, conducting audits, and implementing policies and procedures to ensure adherence to regulatory requirements.

document_types.name: Organizational Structures and Oversight Functions
document_types.purpose: To document organizational structures and oversight functions, including policies, standards, and procedures for compliance.

document_types.name: Professional Ethics and Business Practices Program
document_types.purpose: To document the professional ethics and business practices program.

document_types.name: Compliance Program for Marketing and Selling Activities
document_types.purpose: To document the compliance program for marketing and selling activities.

domains.name: Endpoint Security
domains.description: Endpoint Security involves protecting the endpoints (devices such as laptops, desktops, and mobile devices) within an organization's network. It includes implementing security measures to prevent unauthorized access, malware, and other threats.
domains.importance: Endpoint Security is crucial for protecting sensitive data and preventing security breaches. It helps ensure that all devices accessing the organization's network are secure and compliant with security policies.
domains.relation_to_organization: Endpoint Security relates to the organization by ensuring that all endpoints are secure and protected against threats. It includes implementing security controls, monitoring endpoints, and responding to security incidents.

document_types.name: Endpoint Security Configuration Standards
document_types.purpose: To document the policies and procedures for endpoint security configuration standards.

document_types.name: Use of Removable Devices
document_types.purpose: To document the organization's process for restricting the use of removable devices.

document_types.name: End User Device Access Logging
document_types.purpose: To document the policies and procedures for end user device log on activity logging.

domains.name: Network Security
domains.description: Network Security involves measures to protect the organization's network infrastructure from unauthorized access, misuse, malfunction, modification, destruction, or improper disclosure. It ensures the integrity, confidentiality, and availability of data transmitted across the network.
domains.importance: Network Security is essential for protecting the organization's network and data from cyber threats. It helps prevent data breaches, ensures data integrity, and maintains the availability of network services.
domains.relation_to_organization: Network Security relates to the organization by providing a framework for securing the network infrastructure. It includes implementing security controls, monitoring network traffic, and responding to security incidents.

document_types.name: Network Security Diagram and Policies
document_types.purpose: To document the current network diagram and related security policies.

document_types.name: Deployment of IDS/IPS Systems
document_types.purpose: To document the policies and procedures for deploying Intrusion Detection Systems (IDS) and Intrusion Prevention Systems (IPS).

document_types.name: Firewalls, Routers, and Devices Deployment
document_types.purpose: To document the deployment of firewalls, routers, or devices to protect the organization from outside entities.

domains.name: Environ, Social, Gov (ESG)
domains.description: Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) refers to the three central factors in measuring the sustainability and societal impact of an organization. ESG criteria help evaluate how an organization manages risks and opportunities related to environmental, social, and governance issues.
domains.importance: ESG is important for ensuring that the organization operates in a sustainable and socially responsible manner. It helps attract investors, improves risk management, and enhances the organization's reputation.
domains.relation_to_organization: ESG relates to the organization by providing a framework for managing environmental, social, and governance risks and opportunities. It includes developing policies and programs that promote sustainability, social responsibility, and good governance practices.

document_types.name: Environmental Policy and Objectives
document_types.purpose: To document the organization's environmental policy and objectives.

document_types.name: Social Policy and Objectives
document_types.purpose: To document the organization's social policy and objectives.

document_types.name: Governance Program
document_types.purpose: To document how the organization is led, managed, and incentivizes stakeholder expectations.

domains.name: Privacy Management
domains.description: Privacy Management involves the policies, procedures, and practices for protecting personal data and ensuring compliance with privacy laws and regulations. It includes managing data privacy risks and ensuring that personal data is handled responsibly.
domains.importance: Privacy Management is essential for protecting individuals' personal data and ensuring compliance with privacy laws. It helps prevent data breaches, protects the organization's reputation, and ensures that personal data is handled responsibly.
domains.relation_to_organization: Privacy Management relates to the organization by providing a framework for managing data privacy risks. It includes developing policies and procedures for data protection, conducting privacy impact assessments, and ensuring compliance with privacy regulations.

document_types.name: Client-Scoped Data Inventory and Privacy Policies
document_types.purpose: To document the organization's client-scoped data inventory and privacy policies.
document_types.compliance: Complies with GDPR and other relevant regulations

document_types.name: Data Privacy or Data Protection Program Structure
document_types.purpose: To document the organizational structure and scope of the data privacy or data protection program.
document_types.compliance: Complies with GDPR and other relevant regulations

document_types.name: Privacy Awareness Training Schedule
document_types.purpose: To document the delivery and schedule of privacy awareness training.
document_types.compliance: Complies with GDPR and other relevant regulations

domains.name: Artificial Intelligence (AI)
domains.description: Artificial Intelligence (AI) involves the development and use of algorithms and systems that can perform tasks that typically require human intelligence. It includes areas such as machine learning, natural language processing, and robotics.
domains.importance: AI is important for driving innovation, improving efficiency, and enabling new capabilities within the organization. It helps automate processes, analyze large datasets, and support decision-making.
domains.relation_to_organization: AI relates to the organization by providing tools and technologies that enhance business operations. It includes developing AI strategies, managing AI risks, and ensuring that AI systems are used ethically and responsibly.

document_types.name: AI Risk Management Policies and Practices
document_types.purpose: To document the policies, processes, procedures, and practices for mapping, measuring, and managing AI risks.

document_types.name: AI Risk Management Accountability Structure
document_types.purpose: To provide evidence of an accountability structure for roles and responsibilities in AI risk management.

document_types.name: DEI Priorities in AI Risk Management
document_types.purpose: To document DEI priorities and accessible workforce processes for managing AI risks through the lifecycle.

domains.name: Supply Chain Risk Management
domains.description: Supply Chain Risk Management involves identifying, assessing, and mitigating risks associated with the supply chain. It ensures the reliability and resilience of the supply chain and minimizes disruptions.
domains.importance: Supply Chain Risk Management is critical for ensuring that the organization can continue to operate despite disruptions in the supply chain. It helps maintain the flow of goods and services, reduces costs, and protects the organization's reputation.
domains.relation_to_organization: Supply Chain Risk Management relates to the organization by ensuring that all supply chain activities are resilient and reliable. It includes developing policies and procedures for managing supply chain risks, conducting risk assessments, and monitoring the supply chain.

document_types.name: Access Control and Account Management Practices
document_types.purpose: To document the policies, procedures, or standards for access control and account management practices.

document_types.name: Audit Mechanisms for Supply Chain Events
document_types.purpose: To document the policies, procedures, or standards for using appropriate audit mechanisms to monitor supply chain-relevant events.

document_types.name: Assessment, Authorization, and Monitoring Practices
document_types.purpose: To document the policies, procedures, or standards for assessment, authorization, and monitoring practices.

domains.name: Threat Management
domains.description: Threat Management involves identifying, assessing, and mitigating threats to the organization. It includes implementing security measures to protect against cyber threats, physical threats, and other types of risks.
domains.importance: Threat Management is essential for protecting the organization from various types of threats. It helps ensure the safety of personnel, the security of information, and the continuity of operations.
domains.relation_to_organization: Threat Management relates to the organization by providing a framework for managing threats. It includes developing policies and procedures for threat identification, implementing security measures, and responding to incidents.

document_types.name: Anti-Malware Controls
document_types.purpose: To document the policies, procedures, or standards for the deployment of controls for anti-malware.

document_types.name: Virus Protection Software Deployment and Maintenance
document_types.purpose: To document the procedures for deploying and maintaining virus protection software.

document_types.name: Vulnerability Scans on Internal System Components
document_types.purpose: To document the process for internal and/or external vulnerability scans on internal system components and networks.

domains.name: Server Security
domains.description: Server Security involves protecting the organization's servers from unauthorized access, data breaches, and other threats. It includes implementing security measures to ensure the integrity, confidentiality, and availability of server data.
domains.importance: Server Security is critical for protecting sensitive data stored on servers. It helps prevent data breaches, ensures data integrity, and maintains the availability of server resources.
domains.relation_to_organization: Server Security relates to the organization by providing a framework for securing servers. It includes implementing security controls, monitoring server activity, and responding to security incidents.

document_types.name: System Configuration and Hardening Standards
document_types.purpose: To document the current, approved system configuration and hardening standards for each type of operating system in use.

document_types.name: Non-Windows Operating System Standards
document_types.purpose: To document the current, approved system configuration and hardening standard for each type of non-Windows based operating system.

document_types.name: Patch Management Policies and Procedures
document_types.purpose: To document the policies and operational procedures specific to patch management.

domains.name: Cloud Services
domains.description: Cloud Services involve the use of cloud computing technologies to deliver services over the internet. It includes managing cloud infrastructure, ensuring data security, and complying with regulatory requirements.
domains.importance: Cloud Services are important for enabling scalable and flexible IT solutions. They help reduce costs, improve efficiency, and support business continuity.
domains.relation_to_organization: Cloud Services relate to the organization by providing IT resources and services through the cloud. It includes managing cloud security, ensuring compliance with regulations, and integrating cloud services with existing IT infrastructure.

document_types.name: Cloud Service Provider (CSP) Security Policies
document_types.purpose: To document the security policies, controls, and delineation of security responsibilities related to the use of Cloud Service Provider (CSP) services.
document_types.compliance: Complies with relevant cloud security standards

document_types.name: Cloud Hosting Governance Process
document_types.purpose: To document the company's governance process for cloud hosting.
document_types.compliance: Complies with relevant cloud security standards
